newsitem.title: USA: Police confirm Cunanan committed suicide.
newsitem.headline: Police confirm Cunanan committed suicide.

text.p: Police confirmed Thursday that Andrew Cunanan, suspected killer of fashion designer Gianni Versace, committed suicide.
Cunanan left no message, Miami Beach Police Chief Richard Barreto told a news conference.
He said Cunanan's body was found on the second floor of a houseboat which police stormed on Wednesday evening.

"The medical examiners confirm he died of a single gunshot wound to the head," Barreto said. "To date there has been no suicide note or other correspondence from Mr. Cunanan that would relate why he committed the crimes he is accused of."
Cunanan, a 27-year-old gay gigolo, was the only suspect in the July 15 killing of Versace. He was also wanted in connection with four other murders.
Barreto said the Versace homicide was still considered open as a lot of evidence still had to be processed.
